content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Locate a hotel in Melbourne offering free parking and free WiFi, for a stay from February 28 to March 4, 2024.  Please interact with https://www.booking.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To begin searching for a hotel in Melbourne, I first need to specify the destination. The textbox labeled "Where are you going?" (14) is the correct field to start entering "Melbourne".
Action: Type [14]; Melbourne
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The location is incorrectly set to "Niagara Falls". Additionally, I need to change the check-in and check-out dates to February 28 to March 4, 2024. Currently, the calendar is displaying September and October 2025, far ahead of the target dates. I should start by navigating the calendar to earlier months.
Action: Click [18] (Next month - I need to see if this toggles a previous month option. If not, I'll look for another way to go to February 2024).
Confidence: 0.8
Completion: 0.2
token: : Click [18] (Next month - I need to see if this toggles a previous month option. If not, I'll look for another way to go to February 2024).

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Now there is a "Previous month" button (18) available, which should allow navigating backwards through the calendar months toward February 2024. I will keep clicking this button until I reach the desired date range.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is still displaying future dates (September and October 2025). I need to continue going backwards by clicking "Previous month" repeatedly until I reach February and March 2024.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is still showing October and November 2025. I need to continue navigating to earlier months to reach February and March 2024 by repeatedly clicking "Previous month".
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar has switched back to showing September and October 2025, indicating a loop or a mis-click. To go back in time, I must look for the correct "Previous month" button if available, but based on this image, the numerical label for "Previous month" has changed or disappeared; only "Next month" [18] is labeled now. I need to locate and click the correct "Previous month" control again if it appears, otherwise I may have to re-open the calendar or re-click the control if this is a labeling anomaly.
Action: Click [16] (Re-open or refocus calendar, as the navigation button may have shifted)
Confidence: 0.7
Completion: 0.25
token: : Click [16] (Re-open or refocus calendar, as the navigation button may have shifted

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is still on September and October 2025, and only a "Next month" button [18] is visible, with no "Previous month" button available. This could indicate a UI issue or a need to reset and re-open the calendar or the search. Alternatively, the calendar navigation may require clicking elsewhere to refresh or re-enable backward navigation.
Action: Click [15] (on the "Check-in date — Check-out date" field to try to reset calendar navigation)
Confidence: 0.7
Completion: 0.25
token: : Click [15] (on the "Check-in date — Check-out date" field to try to reset calendar navigation

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The system has exited the calendar, but the destination is still set to "Niagara Falls" instead of "Melbourne." In order to move forward, I need to change the destination to "Melbourne" using the input field.
Action: Type [13]; Melbourne
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar remains open on September and October 2025, but the input field for the destination [13] is active. I should finish updating the destination field by confirming the text entry or pressing enter, which might also refresh the search parameters to "Melbourne".
Action: Click [99] (Search button, to confirm the new destination)
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.35
token: : Click [99] (Search button, to confirm the new destination

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is still open, showing dates in September and October 2025. There is no visible "Previous month" button, only a "Next month" button [18]. It appears my last search did not trigger a destination update, and the calendar was not reset to 2024. I need to close or reset the calendar and re-focus on the destination field update, or else find a way to reach earlier months.
Action: Click [15] (Try to close the calendar and fully reset the search fields for destination and date)
Confidence: 0.8
Completion: 0.35
token: : Click [15] (Try to close the calendar and fully reset the search fields for destination and date

The destination field still says "Niagara Falls," so the location has not updated yet. I must try to close the calendar to regain control over the destination and restart the search correctly for Melbourne.
Action: Click [15] (to close the open calendar and allow destination editing)
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.4
